Class PhoneValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • PhoneValidator
  • public class PhoneValidator
extends java.lang.Object
    PhoneValidator class checks if phone number is correct

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      PhoneValidator()
      Class constructor that adds default countries for validation rules: LT (+370), LV (+371), EST (+372), FR (+33)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addValidationPhoneRule​(java.lang.String countryCode, java.lang.String countryPhonePrefix, int phoneNumberLength)
      adds a validation rule that can be used to validate a new phone number with different phone prefix and length
      java.lang.String changeThePrefix​(java.lang.String phoneNumber)
      returns a phone number with lithuanian prefix.
      boolean checkIfCountryIsValid​(java.lang.String countryCode, java.lang.String phoneNumber)
      checks if given country code is registered as valid validation rule and if the number is correct for that country's rule
      boolean checkIfStartsWithCountryCode​(java.lang.String phoneNumber)
      checks if the given phone number starts with country prefix (has a + sign)
      boolean checkPhoneNotNull​(java.lang.String phoneNumber)
      checks if given phone number is not null
      boolean checkPhoneOnlyNumbers​(java.lang.String phoneNumber)
      checks if phone number is made from only numbers and possible '+' sign in front
      boolean validatePhoneNumber​(java.lang.String phoneNumber)
      checks if local (lithuanian) phone number is correct.
      boolean validatePhoneNumber​(java.lang.String phoneNumber, java.lang.String countryCode)
      checks if phone number is correct.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • PhoneValidator

        public PhoneValidator()
        Class constructor that adds default countries for validation rules: LT (+370), LV (+371), EST (+372), FR (+33)

    • Method Detail

      • validatePhoneNumber

        public boolean validatePhoneNumber​(java.lang.String phoneNumber)
        checks if local (lithuanian) phone number is correct. Check numbers, length, prefix (if number is local, adds the prefix "+370")
        Parameters:
        phoneNumber - - the text of local (lithuanian) phone number
        Returns:
        true if phone number is correct to all rules, false otherwise

      • validatePhoneNumber

        public boolean validatePhoneNumber​(java.lang.String phoneNumber,
                                   java.lang.String countryCode)
        checks if phone number is correct. Check numbers, length, prefix, country code and if the country is registered as valid rule
        Parameters:
        phoneNumber - - the text of phone number with country's prefix
        countryCode - - short code of registered country as valid rule
        Returns:
        true if phone number is correct to all rules, false otherwise

      • changeThePrefix

        public java.lang.String changeThePrefix​(java.lang.String phoneNumber)
        returns a phone number with lithuanian prefix. If the number is already with prefix, returns the given phone number
        Parameters:
        phoneNumber - - the text of lithuanian phone number, local or with prefix
        Returns:
        phone number with prefix

      • checkIfStartsWithCountryCode

        public boolean checkIfStartsWithCountryCode​(java.lang.String phoneNumber)
        checks if the given phone number starts with country prefix (has a + sign)
        Parameters:
        phoneNumber - - the text of phone number
        Returns:
        true if phone number starts with +, otherwise false

      • checkIfCountryIsValid

        public boolean checkIfCountryIsValid​(java.lang.String countryCode,
                                     java.lang.String phoneNumber)
        checks if given country code is registered as valid validation rule and if the number is correct for that country's rule
        Parameters:
        countryCode - - text of shortened country code
        phoneNumber - - text of phone number
        Returns:
        true if country code and phone number are correct for registered rule

      • addValidationPhoneRule

        public void addValidationPhoneRule​(java.lang.String countryCode,
                                   java.lang.String countryPhonePrefix,
                                   int phoneNumberLength)
        adds a validation rule that can be used to validate a new phone number with different phone prefix and length
        Parameters:
        countryCode - - text of shortened country code
        countryPhonePrefix - - text of country's phone prefix that starts with +
        phoneNumberLength - - integer of phone number's length

      • checkPhoneNotNull

        public boolean checkPhoneNotNull​(java.lang.String phoneNumber)
        checks if given phone number is not null
        Parameters:
        phoneNumber - - text of given phone number
        Returns:
        true if phone number is not null and false if phone number is null

      • checkPhoneOnlyNumbers

        public boolean checkPhoneOnlyNumbers​(java.lang.String phoneNumber)
        checks if phone number is made from only numbers and possible '+' sign in front
        Parameters:
        phoneNumber - - text of phone number
        Returns:
        true if phone number is only from numbers and possible + in front, false if there are illegal signs
